result.execSummary:
The defendant LaSean E Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $25 per month.  3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
Partial payment plan:  $25 per month. 3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

INCIDENT REPORT from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in violation of agency requirements.

Defendant LaSean E Simmons in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.    Req adj.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 10-01-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 11-02-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant LaSean E Simmons in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Erin Joy Larsen in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
DEF: requesting adjournment
BTC: one week adjournment granted  Initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
